physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 6-yr-old girl presented with multiple small nodules on her tongue, enlargement of the left lobe of the thyroid gland without palpable mass, and several enlarged, mobile submandibular nodes. Basal serum calcitonin level was 850 pg/ml (normal range, 2–17 pg/ml).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Calcitonin levels decreased to 38 pg/ml one month after surgery and later rose to 66 pg/ml six months after thyroidectomy. Eventually, the calcitonin level increased to 235 pg/ml two and a half years after thyroidectomy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 11-yr-old boy had an unstimulated calcitonin level of 44.7 pg/ml (normal range, 0–11.5 pg/ml) and a 7-cm mass in the right suprarenal fossa identified on abdominal CT.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes over time were mentioned.
